title: Flow Work with Ideal Gas in Compressor

problem_statement.question_template: An air compressor compresses {{params.intakeVolume}} L of air at {{params.initialPressure}} kPa at {{params.initialTemperature}} $^\circ\text{C}$ to {{params.finalPressure}} kPa at {{params.finalTemperature}} $^\circ\text{C}$. Determine the specific flow work required by the compressor.

target_answer.name: flowWorkAns
target_answer.description: Specific flow work required by the compressor.

physical_laws: Ideal Gas Law (for relation between $h, u, P, v, T$)
Mayer's Relation for Ideal Gases ($R = c_p - c_v$)

sections: Mass and Energy Analysis of Control Volumes

solution_analysis.key_concept: The specific flow work ($w_{\text{flow}}$) is defined as the work required to push the fluid into or out of the control volume, $w_{\text{flow}} = P v$. For an ideal gas, $P v = R T$. The problem asks for the *change* in specific flow work, $\Delta (P v) = (P_2 v_2) - (P_1 v_1)$.

derivation_steps.description: For an Ideal Gas, $h = u + Pv$, therefore specific flow work is $P v = h - u$.
derivation_steps.equation: $$w_{\text{flow}} = P v = h - u = R T$$

derivation_steps.step_name: Identify Governing Equation for Change in Flow Work
derivation_steps.description: The required flow work is the change in specific flow work from inlet (State 1) to outlet (State 2).

derivation_steps.step_name: Simplify using Ideal Gas Specific Heats
derivation_steps.description: Using $h = c_p T$ and $u = c_v T$, and Mayer's relation $R = c_p - c_v$ (which is implicitly used in the Python code). Note: Temperatures must be in Kelvin (K).
derivation_steps.equation: $$w_{\text{required}} = (c_p T_2 - c_v T_2) - (c_p T_1 - c_v T_1) = R (T_2 - T_1)$$
